Content.Name: Add an Online Quiz/Test
Content.Title: Add an Online Quiz/Test
Content.BodyCopy:
Objective
To demonstrate how to add an online quiz/test in an I-Learn course.

Instructions
  1. Navigate to the "Course Plan" of the desired course.
  2. Locate the Module the assessment is to be added to and click the corresponding "Add."
  3. Click "Assessment."
  4. Fill in the Title and Description.
  5. Add an attachment if desired.
  6. Set an Outcome by checking the "Refine objectives" box and then "Add outcome."
  7. Check "Due date and time," select a date from the calendar and fill in the time for the test to close.
  8. To have the assessment added to the Gradebook be sure the "Add to Gradebook" box is checked. Selecting the "Treated unscored as zero" will automatically mark the grade a 0 after the due date.
  9. Select "Assessment Settings."
  10. Adjust settings. Number of attempts determines how many times a student can take the assessment. Adjust settings. Number of attempts determines how many times a student can take the assessment. Scored attempt indicated which attempt is scored. Attempt minimum allows you to require the student to to take the test multiple times. Security level determines how the test is graded. Student review settings determine what students are allowed to see after they've taken the assessment. You can allow students to print the assessment while they take it by clicking the corresponding box.
  11. Click "Next."
  12. Click "Multiple Choice" to change question type.
  13. Click "1 point" to change how many points this question will be worth.
  14. Click "Properties" to change the quesion properties.
  15. Click and begin typing where prompted.
  16. Fill in answers where prompted.
  17. Click "Add" to add another question.
  18. If you have assigned outcomes to your assessment, you may assign your questions to those outcomes.
  19. When finished, click "Done."
